thread.title: Toddler falls from second floor window - but thankfully lands on old sofa in the garden
thread.title_full: Toddler falls from second floor window - but thankfully lands on old sofa in the garden

author: Alexandra Rucki
title: Toddler falls from second floor window - but thankfully lands on old sofa in the garden
text:
The youngster was taken to hospital as a precaution - but the girl only suffered a bump on her head (Photo: Mark Waugh)   
A lucky toddler had an amazing escape after plunging from a flat window...and landing on a sofa in the garden. 
The youngster, aged 23 months old, was checked over by medics following her fall, but miraculously was only left with a bump to head. 
Police were called to the block of flats, in Levenshulme , on Tuesday just before 4.40pm after a neighbour witnessed the toddler plummet from a second floor window. Read More Two GMP officers injured after thugs ram stolen BMW into police car 
But the youngster missed hitting the concrete and landed on an abandoned sofa in the garden beneath the window. 
She was taken to hospital but was later allowed home when it was established the girl only suffered a bump on her head. 
Police discovered the toddler managed to get out of the window as it had a damaged latch. Read More Laura Kenny and husband Jason announce they are expecting their first child 
Detectives conducted a safe-guarding review and a follow-up will be made to ensure the landlord fixes the latch. 
Insp Phil Spurgeon, of the GMP City Centre team, said: “A bump was seen on her head but the toddler was apparently otherwise unharmed – officers report her running around the hospital as though nothing had happened. The toddler was released at 9pm having been given the all clear by medical staff. 
“Given the circumstances, a detective-led review of safeguarding took place, but initial thoughts are that this was an accident with a miraculous ending. A follow up will be made to ensure that the landlord fixes the latch.” Like us on Facebook
